cot.content:
To solve the problem, Please think and reason step by step, then answer.
question:
where does the last name orozco originate from
        
Generation Format:
Reasoning process:
Answer:

Reasoning process: 
1. The last name "Orozco" is of Spanish origin. 
2. It is a toponymic surname, which means it is derived from a geographical location or feature. 
3. The name is believed to be derived from a place called Orozco in the province of Zaragoza, Spain. 
4. Orozco can also be linked to the Basque word "oroz," which means "place of the mountain" or "high place."
5. The surname has historical significance and has been carried by various notable individuals and families in Spanish-speaking countries.
6. It is common in Latin America due to Spanish colonization, where many people adopted surnames from their ancestors.

Answer: The last name Orozco originates from Spain, specifically from a place called Orozco in the province of Zaragoza.

anchoring.content:
You are a cognitive scientist, to answer the following question:
where does the last name orozco originate from
I will provide you with several retrieved passages:
Passages:
['Orozco is of Spanish/Basque origin. Notable people with the surname include:\n', 'Orozco was born in Fuengirola, Province of Málaga. After starting out with local UD Fuengirola Los Boliches he joined neighbouring Málaga CF in 2007, representing the reserve team in the fourth division for two seasons.\n', 'BULLET::::- Teodoro Orozco (born 1963)\n', "Rafael José Orozco Maestre (March 24, 1954 in Becerril, Cesar – June 11, 1992 in Barranquilla, Atlántico) was a Colombian singer of vallenato music. He was one of the major representatives of that Colombian popular folk music and lead singer and owner, along fellow accordionist Israel Romero, of the vallenato group Binomio de Oro de América, very popular in Colombia, Mexico and Venezuela. Orozco was assassinated by gunmen in front of his house on his daughter's 15th birthday party. It is believed they were hired by an angry drug lord whose wife-or girlfriend-was obsessed with Orozco. It has been alleged that Orozco had a sentimental relationship with 16 year old Maria Angelica Navarro Ogliasti, identified as the girlfriend of Medellin Cartel hitman Jose Reinaldo Fiallo, who was himself murdered on November 1992 on orders of Pablo Escobar.\n", 'Orozco\n', 'Orozco was born to a middle-class family on Santa Inés hacienda near San Isidro, Guerrero, in the state of Chihuahua. He was a businessman in mining, commercialized minerals and became wealthy from investments in mines, particularly gold.\n', 'Antonio Orozco (born 23 November 1972 in Barcelona) is a Spanish singer-songwriter.\n', 'Orozco died on February 9, 2011 in Austin, Texas.\n', 'Orozco was born in 1962 in Veracruz, Mexico to Cristina Félix Romandía and Mario Orozco Rivera, a mural painter and art professor at the University of Veracruz. When Orozco was six, the family relocated to the San Ángel neighborhood of Mexico City so that his father could work with artist David Alfaro Siquieros on various mural commissions. His father took him along to museum exhibitions and to work with him, during which time Orozco overheard many conversations about art and politics.\n', 'Pedro Orozco\n']

question_info.question: where does the last name orozco originate from
passages:
Orozco is of Spanish/Basque origin. Notable people with the surname include:
Orozco was born in Fuengirola, Province of Málaga. After starting out with local UD Fuengirola Los Boliches he joined neighbouring Málaga CF in 2007, representing the reserve team in the fourth division for two seasons.
BULLET::::- Teodoro Orozco (born 1963)
Rafael José Orozco Maestre (March 24, 1954 in Becerril, Cesar – June 11, 1992 in Barranquilla, Atlántico) was a Colombian singer of vallenato music. He was one of the major representatives of that Colombian popular folk music and lead singer and owner, along fellow accordionist Israel Romero, of the vallenato group Binomio de Oro de América, very popular in Colombia, Mexico and Venezuela. Orozco was assassinated by gunmen in front of his house on his daughter's 15th birthday party. It is believed they were hired by an angry drug lord whose wife-or girlfriend-was obsessed with Orozco. It has been alleged that Orozco had a sentimental relationship with 16 year old Maria Angelica Navarro Ogliasti, identified as the girlfriend of Medellin Cartel hitman Jose Reinaldo Fiallo, who was himself murdered on November 1992 on orders of Pablo Escobar.
Orozco
Orozco was born to a middle-class family on Santa Inés hacienda near San Isidro, Guerrero, in the state of Chihuahua. He was a businessman in mining, commercialized minerals and became wealthy from investments in mines, particularly gold.
Antonio Orozco (born 23 November 1972 in Barcelona) is a Spanish singer-songwriter.
Orozco died on February 9, 2011 in Austin, Texas.
Orozco was born in 1962 in Veracruz, Mexico to Cristina Félix Romandía and Mario Orozco Rivera, a mural painter and art professor at the University of Veracruz. When Orozco was six, the family relocated to the San Ángel neighborhood of Mexico City so that his father could work with artist David Alfaro Siquieros on various mural commissions. His father took him along to museum exhibitions and to work with him, during which time Orozco overheard many conversations about art and politics.
Pedro Orozco
